Class SimpleMapIO

  • java.lang.Object

  • public class SimpleMapIO
extends java.lang.Object
    Loads objects using SimpleWorldFactory. TODO This class has been updated from pre 1.0, and needs to be tested.

    1.0
    Author:

    • Method Detail

      • openMap

        public boolean openMap()
        Open a map stream.
        Returns:
        True iff the stream was opened successfully.

      • writeMap

        public boolean writeMap(SimpleMap m)
        Write a map to a file. This method can save the specific properties of a SimpleObject through its getDescription() method which the user can override. This method is not optimized for efficiency, and it does not save any global state associated with the SimpleWorld such as which SimpleWorldObject should be used or which object SimpleWorld should follow with the camera. The user should implement their own methods for saving game state. This method is best used to load the initial state of the game. Note: Introducing limited global state through a singleton can be used to set up default settings for a SimpleWorld. The format of the saved file will be: < int: number of objects >
        < int: map width >
        < int: map height >
        < int: map cellWidth >
        < int: map cellHeight >
        # count = |map_objects|
        for (s in map_objects) do
            < int: s.id >
            < int: s.coor_x >
            < int: s.coor_y >
            < utf_string: s.description >
        done.
        Parameters:
        m - The map to be saved.
        Returns:
        True if the map was saved successfully.
        See Also:
        SimpleObject, SimpleMap

      • readMap

        public SimpleMap readMap()
        Read a mp from a file. Reverses the process defined by SimpleMapIO.writeMap.
        Returns:
        The SimpleMap represented by the file.
        See Also:
        SimpleWorldFactory

      • closeMap

        public void closeMap()
        Closes and input or output streams to the file.
